fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.vars.histories

Class PiecewiseInterExtrapolatedValueHistory

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.vars.histories.ValueHistory<java.lang.Double>
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.vars.histories.PiecewiseInterExtrapolatedValueHistory

  • public class PiecewiseInterExtrapolatedValueHistory
extends ValueHistory<java.lang.Double>
    The class PiecewiseInterExtrapolatedValueHistory implements a value history for which an inter/extrapolation function is computed to be used when evaluating the value at some given time.

    Description

    The type of interpolation function is defined by an interpolator generator passed to the object through the constructors. Currently, a piecewise linear and a constrained cubic spline interpolator are defined by the library.

    Glass-box Invariants

     invariant       function != null

    Black-box Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2021-12-07

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      • PiecewiseInterExtrapolatedValueHistory

        public PiecewiseInterExtrapolatedValueHistory(IncrementalInterpolatorGeneratorI interpolatorGenerator)
        create a piecewise linear value history with the an infinite time window and an interpolator to be obtained from interpolatorGenerator.

        Contract

         pre     interpolatorGenerator != null
 post    ValueHistory.checkInvariant(this)
 post    PiecewiseInterExtrapolatedValueHistory.checkInvariant(this)
 post    getCurrentSize() == 0
        Parameters:
        interpolatorGenerator - interpolated pieces creator defining an order and a type of polynomial.

      • PiecewiseInterExtrapolatedValueHistory

        public PiecewiseInterExtrapolatedValueHistory(Duration historyWindow,
                                              IncrementalInterpolatorGeneratorI interpolatorGenerator)
        create a piecewise linear value history with the given time window and interpolator.

        Contract

         pre     historyWindow != null
 pre     historyWindow.greaterThan(Duration.zero(historyWindow.getTimeUnit()))
 pre     interpolatorGenerator != null
 post    getCurrentSize() == 0
        Parameters:
        historyWindow - time window governing the size of the history.
        interpolatorGenerator - interpolated pieces creator defining an order and a type of polynomial.

      • trimToWindow

        public void trimToWindow()
        Description copied from class: ValueHistory
        delete all values in the history that are too old to be in the history time window but leave at least one value if there was one nor more before the trim.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    getCurrentSize()_at_pre == 0 || getCurrentSize() > 0
        Overrides:
        trimToWindow in class ValueHistory<java.lang.Double>
        See Also:
        ValueHistory.trimToWindow()

      • evaluateAt

        public java.lang.Double evaluateAt(Time t)
        evaluate the value function at time t using a linear interpolation/extrapolation scheme; if the history contains one or zero value, the method of the superclass is called; if the time t is smaller than the oldest time (resp. larger than the largest time) in the value history, a linear extrapolation from the oldest (resp. youngest) piece is used, otherwise standard linear interpolation is used.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no more preconditions.
 post    true        // no more postconditions.
        Overrides:
        evaluateAt in class ValueHistory<java.lang.Double>
        Parameters:
        t - time at which the value is required.
        Returns:
        the value at the time t.
        See Also:
        ValueHistory.evaluateAt(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time)
